00030 #include <linux/fs.h>      // basic file structures and methods
00031 #include <linux/types.h>   // basic data types
00032 #include <linux/errno.h>   // error codes
00033 #include <linux/slab.h>    // kmalloc, kmfree
00034 #include <asm/io.h>        // ioremap, ...
00035 #include <asm/uaccess.h>   // user space memory access (e.g. copy_to_user)
00036 #include <linux/ioport.h>  // detecting and reserving system resources
00037 #include <asm/system.h>
00038 #include <linux/module.h>
00039 #ifdef ARM_UCLIB
00040 #include <linux/mtd/mtd.h> // ioctl cmds and structs for eraseall command
00041 #endif //ARM_UCLIB
00042 #include "dcs_driver.h"
00043 #include "rcu_flash.h"
00044 #include "mrKernLogging.c"
00045 
00046 /*
00047  * default major no of the driver if used standalone
00048  */
00049 static int rcuf_majorID=151; /* fixed major no */
00050 
00051 // the default values can be changed at driver load time
00052 static int rcuf_size   = 0x400;
00053 
00054 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00055 // the bus lines are directly set via registers
00056 #define RCUF_ADDR_WIDTH  32
00057 static int rcuf_addrlines_physaddr  = 0x80000090; // address bus
00058 
00059 #define RCUF_DATA_WIDTH   8
00060 static int rcuf_data_out_physaddr  = 0x80000030; // data bus
00061 static int rcuf_data_in_physaddr  = 0x80000080; // data bus
00062 
00063 #define RCUF_CTRL_WIDTH   8
00064 static int rcuf_bus_ctrl_physaddr  = 0x80000070; // strobe signal
00065 /* control lines
00066  * bit 7: direct bus access if (high active)
00067  * bit 6: flash (0) /selectmap (1)
00068  * bit 5: reset (high active) not yet used
00069  * bit 4: not used for flash
00070  * bit 3: out enable (low active)
00071  * bit 2: not used for flash
00072  * bit 1: write enable (low active)
00073  * bit 0: chip enable (low active)
00074  */
00075 #define RCU_BUS_DIRECT_ACCESS_ACTIVATE 0x80
00076 #define RCU_BUS_SELECTMAP_ACTIVATE     0x40
00077 #define RCU_BUS_FLASH_RESET            0x20
00078 #define RCU_BUS_FLASH_OE_INACTIVE      0x08
00079 #define RCU_BUS_FLASH_WE_INACTIVE      0x02
00080 #define RCU_BUS_FLASH_CE_INACTIVE      0x01
00081 #define RCU_BUS_FLASH_INACTIVE_LINES   RCU_BUS_FLASH_OE_INACTIVE | RCU_BUS_FLASH_WE_INACTIVE | RCU_BUS_FLASH_CE_INACTIVE
00082 
00083 #define RCU_BUS_READ_STROBE            0xa9
00084 #define RCU_BUS_WRITE_STROBE           0xaa
00085 #define RCU_BUS_FLASH_ACCESS           0xaf
00086 #define RCU_BUS_DISABLE_DIRECT_ACCESS  0x2f
00087 
00088 #define RCUF_START_FLASH_ACCESS() writel(RCU_BUS_FLASH_ACCESS, rcuf_virtctrl)
00089 #define RCUF_STOP_FLASH_ACCESS()  writel(RCU_BUS_DISABLE_DIRECT_ACCESS, rcuf_virtctrl)
00090 #define RCUF_SET_ADDRESS(addr)    writel(addr,rcuf_virtaddr)
00091 #define RCUF_SET_DATA(data)       writeb(data,rcuf_virtdtao)
00092 #define RCUF_GET_DATA()           readb(rcuf_virtdtai)
00093 #define RCUF_READ_STROBE()        writel(RCU_BUS_READ_STROBE, rcuf_virtctrl)
00094 #define RCUF_WRITE_STROBE()       writel(RCU_BUS_WRITE_STROBE, rcuf_virtctrl)
00095 #define RCUF_STROBE_END()         writel(RCU_BUS_FLASH_ACCESS, rcuf_virtctrl)
00096 
00097 // the pointers used after remapping of the resources
00098 static u32* rcuf_virtaddr  = ((u32 *) 0x0); // address lines
00099 static u32* rcuf_virtdtao  = ((u32 *) 0x0); // data lines write
00100 static u32* rcuf_virtdtai  = ((u32 *) 0x0); // data lines read
00101 static u32* rcuf_virtctrl  = ((u32 *) 0x0); // control lines
00102 
00103 #else //DCSC_TEST
00104 // test memory for the driver simulation
00105 static u32* rcuf_virtbase = ((u32 *) 0x0);
00106 
00107 static u32 rcuf_vaddr_sim    = 0;
00108 static u32 rcuf_vdata_sim    = 0;
00109 
00110 #define RCUF_START_FLASH_ACCESS()
00111 #define RCUF_STOP_FLASH_ACCESS()
00112 #define RCUF_SET_ADDRESS(addr) rcuf_vaddr_sim = addr
00113 #define RCUF_SET_DATA(data) rcuf_vdata_sim = data
00114 #define RCUF_GET_DATA() rcuf_vdata_sim
00115 #define RCUF_READ_STROBE() rcuf_simulate_read(1)
00116 #define RCUF_WRITE_STROBE() rcuf_simulate_write(1)
00117 #define RCUF_STROBE_END()
00118 
00119 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00120 
00121 /*
00122  * define parameters which might be changed at driver load
00123  */
00124 MODULE_PARM(rcuf_majorID, "i");            // the major id for the installation of the driver
00125 MODULE_PARM(rcuf_size, "i");               // size of the flash in byte
00126 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00127 MODULE_PARM(rcuf_addrlines_physaddr, "i");          // address bus
00128 MODULE_PARM(rcuf_data_out_physaddr, "i");           // data bus write
00129 MODULE_PARM(rcuf_data_in_physaddr, "i");            // data bus read
00130 MODULE_PARM(rcuf_bus_ctrl_physaddr, "i");           // strobe
00131 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00132

00134 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("rcu flash memory driver");
00135 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");

00143 
00144 /**************************************************************************************************
00145  * some helper functions to check the address space
00146  */
00147 // very basic MEMTEST
00148 // size in u8, test in u32
00149 static int rcuf_memtest(u32 begin, u32 size) {
00150   u32 i,rd;
00151   int ret=0;
00152   int success=0;
00153   for (i=0;i<size;i+=4) {
00154     writel(i+1, begin + i);
00155   }
00156 
00157   for (i=0;i<size;i+=4) {
00158     rd=readl(begin + i);
00159     if (  rd != i+1 ) {
00160       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "Read fail @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,i);
00161       ret++;
00162     } else {
00163       success++;
00164       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Read succeeded @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,i+1);
00165     }
00166   }
00167   //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG " %d read cycles succeeded", success);
00168   return ret;
00169 }
00170 
00171 static int rcuf_writevalue (u32 begin, u32 size, u32 value) {
00172    int i=0;
00173    u32 offs=0;
00174    for (i=0;i<size;i+=4){
00175      writel(value,begin+i);
00176      offs++;
00177    }
00178    return i;
00179 }
00180 
00181 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00182 /**************************************************************************************************
00183  * basic internal functions for the real flash
00184  */
00185 
00186 /* erase the flash memory
00187  * parameters:
00188  *  begin: start offset
00189  *  size:  size of the buffer in BYTE
00190  */
00191 static int rcu_flash_erase (u32 begin, u32 size) 
00192 {
00193   int iResult=size;
00194   mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "flash erase not yet implemented");
00195   return iResult;
00196 }
00197 
00198 #else 
00199 /**************************************************************************************************
00200  * basic internal functions for the simulated driver
00201  * see function and parameter description above 
00202  */
00203 
00204 static int rcu_flash_erase (u32 offset, u32 size) 
00205 {
00206   int iResult=0;
00207   if (rcuf_virtbase!=NULL) {
00208     u32 address=(u32)rcuf_virtbase+offset;
00209     iResult=rcuf_writevalue(address, size, 0);
00210   } else {
00211     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "erase: write access denied");
00212     iResult=-EFAULT;
00213   }
00214   return iResult;
00215 }
00216 
00217 static int rcuf_simulate_read(int wordsize) 
00218 {
00219   int iResult=0;
00220   if (rcuf_virtbase!=NULL) {
00221     u8* address=(u8*)rcuf_virtbase+rcuf_vaddr_sim;
00222     switch (wordsize) {
00223     case 4:
00224       rcuf_vdata_sim = *((u32*)address); //readl(address);
00225       iResult=wordsize;
00226       break;
00227     case 2:
00228       rcuf_vdata_sim = *((u16*)address); //readw(address);
00229       iResult=wordsize;
00230       break;
00231       break;
00232     case 1:
00233       rcuf_vdata_sim = *address; //readb(address);
00234       break;
00235     default:
00236       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: invalid wordsize %d", wordsize);
00237       iResult=-EFAULT;
00238     }
00239   } else {
00240     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: write access denied");
00241     iResult=-EFAULT;
00242   }
00243   return iResult;
00244 }
00245 
00246 static int rcuf_simulate_write(int wordsize) 
00247 {
00248   int iResult=0;
00249   if (rcuf_virtbase!=NULL) {
00250     u8* address=(u8*)rcuf_virtbase+rcuf_vaddr_sim;
00251     switch (wordsize) {
00252     case 4:
00253       //writel(rcuf_vdata_sim,address);
00254       *((u32*)address)=rcuf_vdata_sim;
00255       iResult=wordsize;
00256       break;
00257     case 2:
00258       {
00259     u16 u16data=rcuf_vdata_sim&0xffff;
00260     //writew(u16data,address);
00261     *((u16*)address)=u16data;
00262     iResult=wordsize;
00263       }
00264       break;
00265     case 1:
00266       {
00267     u8 u8data=rcuf_vdata_sim&0xff;
00268     //writeb(u8data,address);
00269     *((u8*)address)=u8data;
00270     iResult=wordsize;
00271       }
00272       break;
00273     default:
00274       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: invalid wordsize %d", wordsize);
00275       iResult=-EFAULT;
00276     }
00277   } else {
00278     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: write access denied");
00279     iResult=-EFAULT;
00280   }
00281   return iResult;
00282 }
00283 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00284 
00285 
00286 /**************************************************************************************************
00287  * basic internal functions
00288  */
00289 
00290 /* read from memory
00291  * the readl and readb functions are provided by the system and must be used to read from 
00292  * io memory initialized by ioremap (see init_module)
00293  * parameters:
00294  *  begin: start offset
00295  *  size:  size of the buffer in BYTE
00296  *  buff:  pointer to buffer that receives data
00297  */
00298 static int rcu_flash_read (u32 address, u32 size, u32* buff) 
00299 {
00300   int iResult=0;
00301   int i=0;
00302   u32 wordoffs=0;
00303   if ( 1 
00304 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00305       && rcuf_virtaddr!=NULL && rcuf_virtdtai!=NULL && rcuf_virtctrl!=NULL
00306 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00307       ) {
00308     /* later optimization
00309        for (i=0;i<size/4 && iResult>=1;i++){// do the multibles of 4
00310        RCUF_SET_ADDRESS(address+i*4);
00311        iResult=RCUF_READ_STROBE32();
00312        *(buff+wordoffs)=RCUF_SET_DATA32();
00313        RCUF_STROBE_END();
00314        wordoffs++;
00315        }
00316     */
00317     i*=4;
00318     u32 byteoffs=0; 
00319     for (;i<size && iResult>=0;i++) { // do the remaining bytes
00320       RCUF_SET_ADDRESS(address+i);
00321       /*iResult=*/RCUF_READ_STROBE();
00322       *(((char*)(buff+wordoffs))+byteoffs)=RCUF_GET_DATA();
00323       RCUF_STROBE_END();
00324       byteoffs++;
00325     }
00326     iResult=i;
00327   } else {
00328     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: driver not initialized");
00329     iResult=-EFAULT;
00330   }
00331   return iResult;
00332 }
00333 
00334 /* write to memory
00335  * the writel and writeb functions are provided by the system and must be used to write to 
00336  * io memory initialized by ioremap (see init_module)
00337  * parameters:
00338  *  begin: start offset
00339  *  size:  size of the buffer in BYTE
00340  *  buff:  pointer to buffer to write
00341  */
00342 static int rcu_flash_write (u32 address, u32 size, u32* buff) 
00343 {
00344   int iResult=0;
00345   int i=0;
00346   u32 wordoffs=0;
00347   if ( 1 
00348 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00349        && rcuf_virtaddr!=NULL && rcuf_virtdtao!=NULL && rcuf_virtctrl!=NULL
00350 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00351        ) {
00352     /* later optimization
00353        for (i=0;i<size/4 && iResult>=1;i++){// do the multibles of 4
00354        RCUF_SET_ADDRESS(address+i*4);
00355        RCUF_SET_DATA32(*(buff+wordoffs));
00356        iResult=RCUF_WRITE_STROBE32();
00357        RCUF_STROBE_END();
00358        wordoffs++;
00359        }
00360     */
00361     i*=4;
00362     u32 byteoffs=0; 
00363     for (;i<size && iResult>=0;i++) { // do the remaining bytes
00364       RCUF_SET_ADDRESS(address+i);
00365       RCUF_SET_DATA(*(((char*)(buff+wordoffs))+byteoffs));RCUF_WRITE_STROBE();
00367       RCUF_STROBE_END();
00368       byteoffs++;
00369     }
00370     iResult=i;
00371   } else {
00372     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: driver not initialized");
00373     iResult=-EFAULT;
00374   }
00375   return iResult;
00376 }

00379 /******************************************************************************************************
00380  ******************************************************************************************************
00381  ******************************************************************************************************
00382  *********   P A R T 2 : file io interface                                                    *********
00383  ******************************************************************************************************
00384  ******************************************************************************************************
00385  *********                                                                                    *********
00386  *********   driver initialization and cleanup                                                *********
00387  *********                                                                                    *********
00388  ******************************************************************************************************/
00389 
00390 /*
00391  * method prototypes see below for implementations
00392  */
00393 static loff_t rcuf_llseek(struct file* filp, loff_t off, int ref);
00394 static int rcuf_read(struct file* filp, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos);
00395 static int rcuf_write(struct file* filp, const char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos);
00396 static int rcuf_open(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp);
00397 static int rcuf_close(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp);
00398 static int rcuf_ioctl(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg);
00399 
00400 /*
00401  * file_operation structure to define the methods for the char device
00402  * the methods are going to be called from the system
00403  * pointers to the methods are provided at driver initialization via the file_operations structure
00404  */
00405 struct file_operations rcuf_fops = {
00406   llseek:  rcuf_llseek,
00407   read:    rcuf_read,
00408   write:   rcuf_write,
00409   ioctl:   rcuf_ioctl,
00410   open:    rcuf_open,
00411   release: rcuf_close,
00412 };
00413 
00414 /******************************************************************************************************
00415  *********                                                                                    *********
00416  *********   initialisation for real memory                                                   *********
00417  *********                                                                                    *********
00418  ******************************************************************************************************/
00419 
00420 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00421 /*
00422  * cleanup of the memory for the real driver
00423  */
00424 void cleanupRealBuffers()
00425 {
00426   // put the cleanup for the flash memory in here
00427   if (rcuf_virtaddr) iounmap((void *)rcuf_virtaddr);
00428   if (rcuf_virtdtao) iounmap((void *)rcuf_virtdtao);
00429   if (rcuf_virtdtai) iounmap((void *)rcuf_virtdtai);
00430   if (rcuf_virtctrl) iounmap((void *)rcuf_virtctrl);
00431 }
00432 
00433 /*
00434  * initialization of the memory for the real driver
00435  */
00436 int initRealBuffers()
00437 {
00438   int iResult=0;
00439   // put the initialization of the flash memory in here
00440   rcuf_virtaddr = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)rcuf_addrlines_physaddr,RCUF_ADDR_WIDTH);
00441   rcuf_virtdtao = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)rcuf_data_out_physaddr,RCUF_DATA_WIDTH);
00442   rcuf_virtdtai = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)rcuf_data_in_physaddr,RCUF_DATA_WIDTH);
00443   rcuf_virtctrl = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)rcuf_bus_ctrl_physaddr,RCUF_CTRL_WIDTH);
00444   mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped ADDRLINES from %p to %p",rcuf_addrlines_physaddr, rcuf_virtaddr);
00445   mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped DATA OUT  from %p to %p",rcuf_data_out_physaddr, rcuf_virtdtao);
00446   mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped DATA IN   from %p to %p",rcuf_data_in_physaddr, rcuf_virtdtai);
00447   mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped BUS CTRL  from %p to %p",rcuf_bus_ctrl_physaddr, rcuf_virtctrl);
00448   if (rcuf_virtaddr && rcuf_virtdtao && rcuf_virtdtai && rcuf_virtctrl){
00449   } else {
00450     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "error accessing bus");
00451     iResult=-EFAULT;
00452   }
00453   return iResult;
00454 }
00455 
00456 /******************************************************************************************************
00457  *********                                                                                    *********
00458  *********   initialisation for simulated memory                                              *********
00459  *********                                                                                    *********
00460  ******************************************************************************************************/
00461 #else //DCSC_TEST
00462 /*
00463  * cleanup of the buffers for the simulated driver
00464  */
00465 void cleanupSimulatedBuffers()
00466 {
00467   if (rcuf_virtbase) kfree(rcuf_virtbase);
00468 }
00469 
00470 /*
00471  * initialization of the buffers for the simulated driver
00472  */
00473 int initSimulatedBuffers()
00474 {
00475   int iResult=0;
00476   int iNofErr=0;
00477   mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "this is a test version");
00478   rcuf_virtbase  = (u32*) kmalloc(rcuf_size, GFP_KERNEL);
00479   if (rcuf_virtbase) mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Allocated simulated flash memory at 0x%p %d bytes", rcuf_virtbase, rcuf_size);
00480   if (rcuf_virtbase){
00481     iNofErr=rcuf_memtest( (u32) rcuf_virtbase , rcuf_size);
00482     rcuf_writevalue((u32)rcuf_virtbase , rcuf_size, 0);
00483     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Test memory: %d errors",iNofErr);
00484   } else {
00485     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "Allocation of memory failed");
00486   }
00487 
00488   return iResult;
00489 }
00490 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00491 
00492 /******************************************************************************************************
00493  *********                                                                                    *********
00494  *********   driver initialisation                                                            *********
00495  *********                                                                                    *********
00496  ******************************************************************************************************/
00497 
00498 /*
00499  * internal init_module 
00500  * called from the system during insmod command in case of a stand-alone driver
00501  * or from the main driver in case of a composite driver
00502  */
00503 int rcuf_init_module(void) {
00504   // TODO check for stuff to cleanup in case of error and undesired termination
00505   int iResult=0;
00506 
00507   // register the driver
00508   iResult = register_chrdev(rcuf_majorID, "rcu flash memory driver", &rcuf_fops);
00509   if (iResult < 0) {
00510     mrlogmessage(LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "module init: can't register driver");
00511   } else {
00512     mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "Module init (compiled "__DATE__", "__TIME__") version %d.%d", RCUFLASH_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER, RCUFLASH_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER);
00513     if (rcuf_majorID == 0) { /* dynamic allocation of major number*/
00514       rcuf_majorID = iResult; 
00515       mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "dynamic allocation of major number: %d", rcuf_majorID);
00516     } else {
00517       mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "register rcu flash memory driver at major no. %d", rcuf_majorID);
00518     }
00519     mrAddLogPrefix("rcu flash: ", __FILE__);
00520 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00521     iResult=initRealBuffers();
00522 #else 
00523     iResult=initSimulatedBuffers();
00524 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00525   }
00526   return iResult;
00527 }
00528 
00529 #ifndef DCSC_COMPOSITE
00530 /*
00531  * init_module called from the system during insmod command
00532  * wrapper to the init function, will only be preset in the case
00533  * of a stand-alone driver
00534  */
00535 int init_module(void) {
00536   return rcuf_init_module();
00537 }
00538 #endif //DCSC_COMPOSITE
00539 
00540 /*
00541  * internal cleanup_module 
00542  * called from the system during insmod command in case of a stand-alone driver
00543  * or from the main driver in case of a composite driver
00544  */
00545 void rcuf_cleanup_module(void) { 
00546   mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "Module exit");
00547 
00548 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00549   cleanupRealBuffers();
00550 #else //DCSC_TEST
00551   cleanupSimulatedBuffers();
00552 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00553 
00554   int iResult=unregister_chrdev(rcuf_majorID, "rcu flash memory driver");
00555   if (iResult<0){
00556     mrlogmessage(LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "unregister returned error %d", iResult);
00557   }
00558 }
00559 
00560 #ifndef DCSC_COMPOSITE
00561 /*
00562  * cleanup_module called from the system during rmmod command
00563  * wrapper to the init function, will only be preset in the case
00564  * of a stand-alone driver
00565  */
00566 void cleanup_module(void) { 
00567   rcuf_cleanup_module();
00568 }
00569 #endif //DCSC_COMPOSITE

00572 /******************************************************************************************************
00573  *********                                                                                    *********
00574  *********   implementation of driver access methods                                          *********
00575  *********                                                                                    *********
00576  ******************************************************************************************************/
00577 
00578 /*
00579  * seek funtion to move the internal file pointer 
00580  */
00581 static loff_t rcuf_llseek(struct file* filp, loff_t off, int ref)
00582 {
00583   loff_t lPosition=0;
00584   if (filp){
00585     // by now the ref parameter is ignored, seek always from beginning
00586     lPosition=off;
00587     mrlogmessage(LOG_LLSEEK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "llseek: position=%lld, offset=%lld, new position=%lld", filp->f_pos, off, lPosition);
00588   } else {
00589     mrlogmessage(LOG_LLSEEK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "llseek: invalid file pointer");
00590     lPosition=-EFAULT;
00591   }
00592   if (lPosition>=0) filp->f_pos=lPosition;
00593   return lPosition;
00594 }
00595 
00596 /*
00597  * file read funtion
00598  * reads 'count' bytes from the flash into the buffer 'buf' and moves the file pointer
00599  * returns the new file position to f_pos if provided
00600  */
00601 static int rcuf_read(struct file* filp, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos)
00602 {
00603   int iResult=0;
00604   if (filp==NULL) {
00605     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: invalid file pointer");
00606     return -EFAULT;
00607   }
00608   if (buf && count>=0){
00609     u32 u32Offset=filp->f_pos;
00610     u32 u32Count=count;
00611     // check for space
00612     if (u32Offset + count > rcuf_size ) {
00613       u32Count=rcuf_size-u32Offset;
00614       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: reading %d bytes(s) from position %d exceeds memory size of %d", count, u32Offset, rcuf_size);
00615     }
00616     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "read: %d Byte(s) at position %d", u32Count, u32Offset);
00617     iResult=rcu_flash_read(u32Offset, u32Count, (u32*)buf);
00618     if (iResult==(int)u32Count) {
00619       filp->f_pos += iResult;
00620       if (f_pos) *f_pos=filp->f_pos;
00621       else mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: invalid parameter f_pos, skipping position increment");
00622     } else if (iResult>=0) {
00623       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: read failure, %d bytes read", iResult);
00624     } else {
00625       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: read failure, error %d", iResult);
00626     }
00627   } else {
00628     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: invalid parameter");
00629     iResult=-EINVAL;
00630   }
00631   return iResult;
00632 }
00633 
00634 /*
00635  * file write funtion
00636  * writes 'count' bytes from the buffer 'buf' to the flash and moves the file pointer
00637  * returns the new file position to f_pos if provided
00638  */
00639 static int rcuf_write(struct file* filp, const char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos)
00640 {
00641   int iResult=0;
00642   if (filp==NULL) {
00643     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: invalid file pointer");
00644     return -EFAULT;
00645   }
00646   if (buf && count>=0){
00647     u32 u32Offset=filp->f_pos;
00648     u32 u32Count=count;
00649     // check for space
00650     if (u32Offset + count > rcuf_size ) {
00651       u32Count=rcuf_size-u32Offset;
00652       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: writing %d bytes(s) from position %d exceeds memory size of %d", count, u32Offset, rcuf_size);
00653     }
00654     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "write: %d Byte(s) at position %d", u32Count, u32Offset);
00655     iResult=rcu_flash_write(u32Offset, u32Count, (u32*)buf);
00656     if (iResult==(int)u32Count) {
00657       filp->f_pos+=iResult;
00658       if (f_pos) *f_pos=filp->f_pos;
00659       else mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: invalid parameter f_pos, skipping position increment");
00660     } else if (iResult>=0) {
00661       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: write failure, partial written (%d bytes)", iResult);
00662     } else {
00663       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: write failure, error %d", iResult);
00664     }
00665   } else {
00666     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: invalid parameter");
00667     iResult=-EINVAL;
00668   }
00669   return iResult;
00670 }

00672 /*
00673  * file open funtion
00674  * initialisation of the file access instances
00675  * multiple instances can be open
00676  */
00677 static int rcuf_open(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp)
00678 {
00679   int iResult=0;
00680 #ifdef DCSC_TEST
00681   if (rcuf_virtbase==NULL)
00682 #else 
00683   if (rcuf_virtaddr==NULL || rcuf_virtdtao==NULL || rcuf_virtdtai==NULL || rcuf_virtctrl==NULL)
00684 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00685   {
00686     mrlogmessage(LOG_OPEN_CLOSE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_CRIT "open: panic, resource address(es) not initialized");
00687     iResult=-EFAULT;
00688   } else {
00689     mrlogmessage(LOG_OPEN_CLOSE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "open");
00690     // put initialisation in here
00691   }
00692   return iResult;
00693 }
00694

00698  * multiple instances can be open, dont cleanup global structures! 
00699  */
00700 static int rcuf_close(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp)
00701 {
00702   int iResult=0;
00703   mrlogmessage(LOG_OPEN_CLOSE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "close");
00704   // put more cleanup in here
00705   return iResult;
00706 }
00707 
00708 /*
00709  * file io control funtion
00710  * special control of the driver through command ids which have to be unique
00711  */
00712 static int rcuf_ioctl(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00713 {
00714   int iResult=0;
00715   if (filp==NULL || inode==NULL) {
00716     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "ioctl: invalid file/inode pointer");
00717     return -EFAULT;
00718   }
00719   switch (cmd) {
00720   case IOCTL_GET_VERSION:
00721     {
00722       if (arg!=0) {
00723     char versionstring[VERSION_STRING_SIZE];
00724     int iLen=snprintf(versionstring, sizeof(versionstring), "%d.%d - %s", RCUFLASH_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER, RCUFLASH_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER, RELEASETYPE);
00725     if (iLen>0) {
00726       copy_to_user((void*)arg, versionstring, iLen);
00727     } else {
00728       copy_to_user((void*)arg, "", 1);
00729     }
00730       }
00731       iResult=(RCUFLASH_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER << 16) + RCUFLASH_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER;
00732     }
00733     break;
00734   case IOCTL_GET_VERS_STR_SIZE:
00735     iResult=VERSION_STRING_SIZE;
00736     break;
00737   case IOCTL_SET_DEBUG_LEVEL:
00738     if (arg>0xffff)
00739       mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "ioctl: log flags are 16 bit wide, skip MSBs of argument");
00740     arg&=0xffff;
00741     mrSetLogFilter((u16)arg);
00742     break;
00743   case IOCTL_SET_LOG_FILE:
00744     if (arg>0) {
00745       if (strlen((char*)arg)<sizeof(g_logfilename)-1) {
00746     sprintf(g_logfilename, (char*)arg);
00747     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "ioctl (0x%x): set logfile name to \'%s\'", cmd, g_logfilename);
00748       } else {
00749     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "iotcl (0x%x): file name to long, maximum name length %d", cmd, sizeof(g_logfilename));
00750     iResult=-EINVAL;
00751       }
00752     } else {
00753       mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "iotcl (0x%x): invalid argument", cmd);
00754       iResult=-EINVAL;
00755     }
00756     break;
00757   case IOCTL_RCUF_GET_FLASH_SIZE:
00758     *((u32*)arg)=rcuf_size;
00759     iResult=rcuf_size;
00760     break;
00761 #ifdef ARM_UCLIB
00762   /* the driver implements the  MEMGETINFO and MEMERASE controls
00763    * to support the eraseall utility
00764    * not all the functionality of the mtd device is supported
00765    */
00766   case MEMGETINFO:
00767     {
00768       struct mtd_info mtd; 
00769       memset(&mtd, 0, sizeof(struct mtd_info));
00770       mtd.size=rcuf_size;
00771       mtd.erasesize=mtd.size;
00772       if (copy_to_user((struct mtd_info *)arg, &mtd,
00773                sizeof(struct mtd_info_user)))
00774     iResult=-EFAULT;
00775     }
00776     break;
00777   case MEMERASE:
00778     {
00779       struct erase_info *erase;
00780 
00781       if((filp->f_mode & 2)) {
00782     erase=kmalloc(sizeof(struct erase_info),GFP_KERNEL);
00783     if (!erase)
00784       iResult = -ENOMEM;
00785     else {
00786       memset (erase,0,sizeof(struct erase_info));
00787       // map the user space structure to the kernel space erase structure
00788       if (copy_from_user(&erase->addr, (u_long *)arg,
00789                  2 * sizeof(u_long))) {
00790         iResult = -EFAULT;
00791       } else {
00792         // put the erase function in here
00793         mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_DBG, KERN_DEBUG "ioctl: erase flash from %#x %d bytes", erase->addr, erase->len);
00794         iResult=rcu_flash_erase(erase->addr, erase->len);
00795       }
00796       if (iResult==erase->len) {
00797         iResult=0; // eraseall command expects 0 for success
00798       } else if (iResult>=0) {
00799         mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "ioctl: flash partially erased %d Byte ", iResult);
00800       } else {
00801         mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "ioctl: error erasing flash (%d)", iResult);
00802       }
00803       kfree(erase);
00804     }
00805       } else {
00806     iResult = -EPERM;
00807       }
00808       break;
00809     }
00810 #endif //ARM_UCLIB
00811   }
00812   return iResult;
00813 }
